content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Working Remotely\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"It is the client's expectation that EPAM Employees assigned to Google projects will be physically present at their work location and not working remotely (unless determined by the Google manager at the outset of the project).  If there are extenuating circumstances that require some remote work, this remains at the discretion of Google manager, with prior review and approval of the EPAM Account Manager. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Bringing Guests to Google\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM Employees are not allowed to bring personal guests to Google at any time. This policy includes, but is not limited to, guests brought onsite for meals or taking meal out of Google offices.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Doing Business with Google\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM Employees should never share confidential or Personally Identifiable Information (PII).  Even if you have information which is not explicitly noted as confidential or PII, it is highly recommended to follow the 'on a need to know basis' rule when sharing any type of Google related information.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"It is strictly forbidden for EPAM employees to conduct sales/business development activities, to provide unsolicited resumes to Google managers (for existing or new projects), or soliciting employees / workers from other companies to join EPAM.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Involvement in such activities could jeopardize EPAM's relationship with the client, and directly impact your employment with EPAM.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Addressing Questions, Concerns and Performance\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In the event a Google manager brings a performance or compliance issue to our attention, we are required to address it. This may result in disciplinary action up to and including your termination with EPAM.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you have questions that are not project or assignment based (i.e. questions about compensation, employment agreements, changing projects, assignment, etc.) Google requires us to ensure that questions and concerns are directed to the EPAM Account Manager only to address. These and other non-project related issues are not topics for EPAM employees to discuss or address with the client. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
